english: Regulations for Qualifying and Hiring Telecommunications Engineers and the Management of Telecommunications Engineering Enterprises
title: 電信工程人員資格取得與遴用及電信工程業管理規則
history: 23 Articles in full enacted and promulgated by National Communications Commission（NCC）on July 8, 2020. Ref：Tung-Chuan-Ji-Chu Tze No. 10963016250

divisions.title: Classification and Qualification of Telecommunications Engineers
Employment and Management of Telecommunications Engineers
Classification and Qualification of Telecommunications Engineering Enterprises
Registration and Management of Telecommunications Engineering Enterprises

articles.content: These Regulations are promulgated pursuant to Section 1 and 3 of Article 41 of the Telecommunications Management Act.

Terms used in these Regulations are defined as follows:
1. Telecommunications engineer（s）: refers to an individual who is responsible for and supervises the construction, maintenance, and operations of the facilities of a telecommunications enterprise, or an individual who is responsible for the construction and supervision of telecommunications equipment connected to the public switched telecommunications network（PSTN）.
2. Telecommunications engineering enterprise（s）: refers to those that engage in the construction and maintenance of interconnection between or among the telecommunications equipment of telecommunications enterprises, or between main distribution equipment in the switching office of a telecommunications enterprise and equipment in subscribers’ premises.

The classification of a telecommunication engineer shall be categorized as either Class A or Class B, the operating ranges of which shall be as follows:
1. Class A telecommunication engineer（s）: refers to an individual who is responsible for and supervises the construction, maintenance, and operations of the facilities of a telecommunications enterprise, or an individual who is responsible for the construction and supervision of telecommunications equipment connected to the public switched telecommunications network（PSTN）.
2. Class B telecommunication engineer（s）: refers to an individual who is responsible for the construction and supervision of telecommunications equipment connected to the PSTN.

Telecommunications engineering enterprises shall select qualified telecommunications engineers.
Telecommunications engineering enterprises shall review qualified telecommunications engineers, complete and submit the qualification review form of recruited telecommunications engineers to the competent authority for review within sixty days. Further changes in employment shall also be reported to the competent authority.

Telecommunications engineering enterprises shall not employ telecommunications engineers in any of the following circumstances:
1. An individual who has been given a guardianship or assistantship pronouncement that has yet been lifted.
2. An individual who has initially acquired the compliance qualification as a telecommunications engineer through examination but has subsequently been revoked of qualifications in accordance with the Examination Law.
3. After review by the competent authority, qualification of the telecommunications engineer（s）listed in the review qualification form of recruited telecommunications engineers were not compliant with Article 4 or 5 of this Regulation.

Prior to operating, a telecommunications engineering enterprise（s）shall apply to the competent authority for approval and issuance of a telecommunications engineering enterprise（s）registration license（hereinafter as “registration license”）.
Upon obtaining the registration license, a telecommunications engineering enterprise shall join a pertinent telecommunications engineering enterprise association in accordance with the Industrial Group Act prior to operating the business.

Those that apply for registration of a Class C telecommunications engineering enterprise shall obtain the following:
1. Capital that exceeds TWD500,000;
2. A legal and fixed place of business.
3. Employs at least one telecommunications engineering personnel who does not hold a position in another telecommunications engineering enterprise（s）in the areas of each of the following subparagraphs:
An electronic engineering technician, electrical engineering technician, information management technician.
Personnel with certification in Class C or above communications technology category, or Class C or above network installation.
Certification in Class C or above interior wire distribution, industrial wire distribution, electronic wire repair, electronic cable repair, electricity change equipment repair, electronic equipment detection category technician issued by the Ministry of Labor or Class A or Class B electrician holding certification in accordance with laws.

The legal representative of the telecommunications engineering enterprise that obtains the qualifications stipulated in Article 10 to Article 12 may hold a position as mandatory telecommunications engineering personnel of that enterprise（hereinafter as “mandatory personnel”）.

If any content of the license registration is to be revised, an application for revision shall be submitted to the competent authority within thirty days after the date of such revision, with proof of related documentation stated in Paragraph 1, Article 14, for a replacement license.
If the registration license is lost or damaged, the telecommunications engineering enterprise shall apply to the competent authority for re-issuance of license registration, with proof of documentation of the company or commercial registration.
The effective period of the re-issued or replaced license, according to Paragraph 1 or 2 of this Article, shall be equal to the original license.

When mandatory personnel resign or fail to conduct his/her duties, replacement mandatory personnel shall be employed within three months and shall be reported to the competent authority for reference.
Should the telecommunications engineering enterprise fail to report to the competent authority, the resigning mandatory personnel may submit the relevant documents of resignation to the competent authority.
Should the telecommunications engineering enterprise fail to replace the number of mandatory personnel within the time limit, the competent authority shall notify the enterprise to undertake corrective action within a prescribed period of time.
Reporting to the competent authority for reference in Paragraph 1 and 2 shall include a photocopy of proof of documents for complying with the qualification of mandatory personnel, photocopy of identification, and consent of employment.

When a telecommunications engineering enterprise applies for suspension of business, the period of suspension shall not exceed one year. The telecommunications engineering enterprise shall submit the license to the competent authority safeguarding. The license shall be returned after operations resume.
When a telecommunications engineering enterprise terminates its business or dissolves its company, the telecommunications engineering enterprise shall apply to the competent authority for permission within one month, and shall return the license to the competent authority.

Those that apply for a certificate of registration, revision, or renewal, or reissuance due to loss or damage in accordance with these Regulations, shall pay fees in accordance with the Charging Standards of Telecommunications Management.

The qualification of an individual who has obtained a license as a senior telecommunications engineer issued by the competent authority shall remain effective as a Class A telecommunication engineer; the qualification of an individual who has obtained a license as a telecommunication engineer issued by the competent authority shall remain effective as a Class B telecommunication engineer.
The period of validity of a registration license obtained by a telecommunications engineering enterprise from the competent authority shall continue until its expiration; prior to expiration of the validity period of the license, the enterprise may apply to the competent authority for renewal in accordance with Article 17 of this Regulation.
These regulations shall come into effect upon July 1, 2020.
